3.  Write your own infix function that can be used in replace of the `cbind` (or column bind) function (feel free to call the `cbind` function in your function :)  Check that the function works on the two data frames below (`df1` & `df2`) and then all three objects (`df1`, `df2`, `vec1`)!

    ```{r, echo = TRUE}
df1 <- data.frame(unif = runif(10), norm = rnorm(10))
df2 <- data.frame(gamma = rgamma(10, shape = 1), beta = rbeta(10, shape1 = 5, shape2 = 1))
vec1 <- rnorm(10, mean = 10)
    ```


    ```{r}
`%col%` <- function(df1, df2) {cbind(df1, df2)}
df1 %col% df2
df1 %col% df2 %col% vec1
    ```
